revised_title: Improving the Barometer: A New Method for Enlarging Divisions
tldr: The author, Robert Hooke, presents an improved barometer design that allows for greater precision in measuring atmospheric pressure. The new design uses two columns of different liquids, separated by a cane, to expand the range of the barometer's divisions. This invention offers a more accurate way to detect subtle changes in atmospheric pressure, which could be useful in meteorology.
